description: Unique identifier for this purchase requisition line record.
Flag controlling automatic generation of procurement documents from this record; confirm with SME.
Indicator used to mark this row for processing or bulk actions; confirm with SME.
Indicates the request was manually created rather than system-generated; confirm with SME.
Identifier of the warehouse or stocking location associated with this request.
Identifier of the inventory part to be procured.
Quantity of the part requested on this line.
Identifier of the vendor selected to supply the part.
Estimated cost for this line in base currency, based on pricing and quantities.
Estimated line cost expressed in a foreign currency, if applicable.
Indicates this line may be fulfilled against an existing blanket purchase order.
Date and time the requisition was submitted.
Requested need-by date for the items.
User who submitted the requisition.
Contact phone number of the requester.
External or internal reference used to track this request.
Department or cost center responsible for this request.
Related maintenance work order driving the purchase, if any.
Asset or equipment this purchase supports.
Associated maintenance procedure or PM task linked to the request; confirm with SME.
Project to which the cost should be charged.
General ledger account to post the expense.
Free-text notes or instructions for this requisition line.
User account associated with this record for ownership or workflow; confirm with SME.
Indicates whether the record is locked from editing.
Status flag showing whether the record is active.
User currently designated as the active owner or assignee; confirm with SME.
System validation or status code for this record.
Human-readable result or message from the validation process.
Monetary amount evaluated during validation, in base currency; confirm with SME.
Reference to a blanket purchase order used during validation, if any; confirm with SME.
Timestamp of the most recent update to this record.
Flag controlling whether notifications are sent for this record; confirm with SME.
Timestamp captured at the last modification event by a user; confirm with SME.
Currency code used by the vendor for pricing.
Unit price of the part in the vendor’s currency.
Identifier linking the part to a specific warehouse/location (part–warehouse key); confirm with SME.
Exchange rate converting vendor currency to base currency applicable to this transaction.
Email address to receive replies to procurement notifications.
User who created the record.
Timestamp when the record was created.
User who last modified the record.
Timestamp when the record was last modified.
